title: Xavier Tillman put his preseason game-winner into perspective
author: Aidan Buchanan
bullets: Boston Celtics “I got three kids, there's really nothing to stress about.
I got real life at home, so I'm not too worried about what happens here.
” Tillman celebrates after game-winner against the Raptors Wednesday night (Charles Krupa/AP).

title: 13 horror books experts say will actually scare you
author: Frances Klemm
bullets: Book Club Local authors, booksellers, and librarians share the terrifying reads they can’t forget.
ShareSend this article to your social connections.
With the countdown to Halloween ticking down, we asked Boston’s horror experts — from best-selling author Paul Tremblay to Boston Public Library staff — to share the books that truly terrified them.

title: New England has one of the best resort airports in America, according to USA Today readers
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Travel Because vacation mode can't happen fast enough.
Church Street Marketplace in Burlington, Vermont.

Jacob Hannah / The New York Times By Kristi Palma October 16, 2025 | 10:53 AM 2 minutes to read Resort airports bring travelers straight into the action, and one of the best in the nation is in Vermont, according to USA Today readers.

title: Release of Israeli hostages celebrated at Oct. 7 exhibit in Boston
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Local News "We had [the hostage returns] on all the screens here and we were just waiting to see the hugs with the families and the partners and everything.
" Survivor Tal Mazor places a “Home” sticker on the photo of the newly released hostage Eitan Abraham Mor, who was 23 at the time of the festival.
He is now 26.

title: MassDOT chief steps down; MBTA GM Phil Eng named interim transportation secretary
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Transportation With a vote of confidence from Gov.
Maura Healey, Eng will pull double duty at MassDOT and the T.
Transportation Secretary Monica Tibbits-Nutt speaks at a press conference at North Station in 2024.

title: Joe Mazzulla provided a quick update on Jaylen Brown’s injury
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Morning Sports Update Brown left the game in the first quarter with an apparent left hamstring injury.
Joe Mazzulla talks with Jaylen Brown and Payton Pritchard during the Celtics' preseason win against the Raptors.

AP Photo/Charles Krupa By Hayden Bird October 16, 2025 | 10:18 AM 3 minutes to read A Jaylen Brown injury update: During the first quarter of the Celtics’ preseason win over the Raptors on Wednesday, Jaylen Brown left the game after appearing to pick up a left hamstring injury.

title: Police searching for group that lifted more than $6K of merchandise from Newbury Street Lululemon
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Crime The four suspects fled the scene in a dark-colored sedan, police said.
Boston police released these photos of four suspects they say were involved in a shoplifting incident Boston Police Department ShareSend this article to your social connections.
Boston police are searching for four suspects they say stole $6,140 worth of Lululemon merchandise on Monday.

title: DiZoglio rallies her troops for audit of Legislature at State House rally
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Politics The Legislature’s noncompliance with the audit passed last year is “slapping voters in the face," said the state auditor.
"Audit the Legislature" signs line the steps of the Massachusetts State House during a rally on Wednesday.
Madison Lucchesi/Boston.
